section.title: lms.djangoapps.bulk_email.api module
section.paragraph: Python APIs exposed by the bulk_email app to other in-process apps.

desc_content.paragraph: Python API for creating a new CourseEmail instance.

list_item.paragraph: course_id (CourseKey) – The CourseKey of the course.
targets (List[String]) – Recipient groups the message should be sent to.
html_message (String) – Email body. Includes HTML markup.
text_message (String, optional) – Plaintext version of email body. Defaults to None.
template_name (String, optional) – Name of custom email template to use. Defaults to None.
from_addr (String, optional) – Custom sending address, if desired. Defaults to None.

desc_content.paragraph: Utility function to determine the targets (recipient groups) selected by an author of a course email.
Historically, this used to be a piece of logic in the CourseEmail model’s create function but has been extracted here so it can be used by a REST API of the instructor_task app.
Utility function for retrieving a CourseEmail instance from a given CourseEmail id.

field_body.paragraph: email_id (int) – The ID of the CourseEmail instance you want to retrieve.
The CourseEmail instance, if it exists.

desc_content.paragraph: Get whether or not emails are enabled in the context of a course.

list_item.paragraph: user – the user object for which we want to check whether emails are enabled
course_id (string) – the course id of the course

field_body.paragraph: True if emails are enabled for the course associated with course_id for the user; False otherwise
AES encrypted token based on the user email

desc_content.paragraph: Utility function that allows a course_email instance to be updated after it has been created.

course_id (CourseKey): The CourseKey of the course. email_id (Int): The PK id value of the course_email instance that is to be updated. targets (List[String]): Recipient groups the message should be sent to. subject (String)): Email subject. html_message (String): Email body. Includes HTML markup. text_message (String, optional): Plaintext version of email body. Defaults to None.
Bases: AppConfig
Application Configuration for bulk_email.
Override this method in subclasses to run code when Django starts.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.bulk_email.data module
section.paragraph: This provides Data models to represent Bulk Email data.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: object
Enum for the available targets (recipient groups) of an email authored with the bulk course email tool.

SEND_TO_MYSELF - Message intended for author of the message SEND_TO_STAFF - Message intended for all course staff SEND_TO_LEARNERS - Message intended for all enrolled learners SEND_TO_COHORT - Message intended for a specific cohort SEND_TO_TRACK - Message intended for all learners in a specific track (e.g. audit or verified)
Given the target of a message, return a boolean indicating whether the target choice is valid.

send email using already opened connection
Bases: ConfigurationModel
Enables site-wide configuration for the bulk_email feature.

Staff can only send bulk email for a course if all the following conditions are true: 1. BulkEmailFlag is enabled. 2. Course-specific authorization not required, or course authorized to use bulk email.
desc_content.comment: toggle_description: If the flag is enabled, course-specific authorization is required, and the course_id is either not provided or not authorized, the feature is not available.

Bases: Model
A way to refer to a particular group (within a course) as a “Send to:” target.

Django hackery in this class - polymorphism does not work well in django, for reasons relating to how each class is represented by its own database table. Due to this, we can’t just override methods of Target in CohortTarget and get the child method, as one would expect. The workaround is to check to see that a given target is a CohortTarget (self.target_type == SEND_TO_COHORT), then explicitly call the method on self.cohorttarget, which is created by django as part of this inheritance setup. These calls require pylint disable no-member in several locations in this class.
Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

section.title: lms.djangoapps.bulk_email.models_api module
section.paragraph: Provides Python APIs exposed from Bulk Email models.

field_body.paragraph: course_id – the course id of the course
True if the Bulk Email feature is disabled for the course associated with the course_id; False otherwise
course_id – the course id of the course
True if the Bulk Email feature is enabled for the course associated with the course_id; False otherwise

desc_content.paragraph: Looks at the currently active configuration model to determine whether the bulk email feature is available.

field_body.paragraph: course_id (string; optional) – the course id of the course

definition_list_item.term: True or False, depending on the following:

definition.paragraph: If the flag is not enabled, the feature is not available. If the flag is enabled, course-specific authorization is required, and the course_id is either not provided

block_quote.paragraph: or not authorixed, the feature is not available.

definition_list_item.term: If the flag is enabled, course-specific authorization is required, and the provided course_id is authorized,

definition.paragraph: If the flag is enabled and course-specific authorization is not required, the feature is available.

list_item.paragraph: user – user whose opt out status is to be returned

field_body.paragraph: True if user has opted out of e-mails for the course associated with course_id, False otherwise.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: Policy
Validate the supplied Message against a specific delivery policy.

field_body.paragraph: message (Message) – The message to run the policy against.

definition.paragraph: A PolicyResult that represents what channels the message should not be delivered over.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.bulk_email.signals module
section.paragraph: Signal handlers for the bulk_email app

desc_content.paragraph: When an email is sent using ACE, this method will create an event to detect ace email success status
When a user is retired from all mailings this method will create an Optout row for any courses they may be enrolled in.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.bulk_email.tasks module
section.paragraph: This module contains celery task functions for handling the sending of bulk email to a course.

desc_content.paragraph: Delegates emails by querying for the list of recipients who should get the mail, chopping up into batches of no more than settings.BULK_EMAIL_EMAILS_PER_TASK in size, and queueing up worker jobs.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.bulk_email.views module
section.paragraph: Views to support bulk email functionalities like opt-out.

desc_content.paragraph: A view that let users opt out of any email updates.
This meant is meant to be the target of an opt-out link or button. The token parameter must decrypt to a valid username. The course_id is the string course key of any course.
Raises a 404 if there are any errors parsing the input.
